metadata.title: CVE-2023-5868 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description: A memory disclosure vulnerability was found in PostgreSQL that allowsremote users to access sensitive information by exploiting certainaggregate function calls with 'unknown'-type arguments. Handling'unknown'-type values from string literals without type designation candisclose bytes, potentially revealing notable and confidential information.This issue exists due to excessive data output in aggregate function calls,enabling remote users to read some portion of system memory.

criterions.comment: postgresql-9.5: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
